Helper class that provides a standard way to create an ABC using inheritance.

class pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.BaseLoadOptions(*, parent_projections_folder: str, loader_type: pyxalign.io.loaders.enums.LoaderType = <LoaderType.PEAR_V1: 'pear_v1'>, file_pattern: Optional[str] = None, scan_start: Optional[int] = None, scan_end: Optional[int] = None, scan_list: Optional[list[int]] = None, file_pattern_priority_list: Optional[list[str]] = None, skip_files_not_in_priority_list: bool = True, only_include_files_with: Optional[list[str]] = None, exclude_files_with: Optional[list[str]] = None, selected_ptycho_strings: Optional[list[str]] = None, ask_for_backup_files: bool = False, select_all_by_default: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: object

ask_for_backup_files: bool = False¶

Whether or not the UI asks for backup files if a projection file is not found.

exclude_files_with: list[str] | None = None¶

Exclude files with any of these strings in the ptycho file string.

file_pattern: str | None = None¶

pattern used by re to identify matching folder strings

file_pattern_priority_list: list[str] | None = None¶

If multiple matching files are found, iterate through this list select the first file that matches the member of this list.

loader_type: LoaderType = 'pear_v1'¶
only_include_files_with: list[str] | None = None¶

Only include files with these strings in the ptycho file string.

parent_projections_folder: str¶
print_selections()[source]¶
scan_end: int | None = None¶

Upper bound of scans to include.

scan_list: list[int] | None = None¶

List of scans to load. This serves as an extra filter, meaning that scan_start, scan_end, file_pattern, and all other settings/filters will still be applied.

scan_start: int | None = None¶

Lower bound of scans to include.

select_all_by_default: bool = False¶
selected_ptycho_strings: list[str] | None = None¶

List of ptycho file strings that are allowed to be loaded, in prioritized order. The ptycho file strings are strings extracted from the projection file names.

skip_files_not_in_priority_list: bool = True¶

Only applies when file_pattern_priority_list is not None. This dictates what to do if there is a scan that has a file that matches file_pattern but not any of the patterns in file_pattern_priority_list.

class pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.Beamline2IDDLoadOptions(base: pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.BaseLoadOptions = <factory>, *, mda_folder: str, _mda_file_pattern: str = 'bnp_fly(\\d+)\\.mda', _angle_pv_string: str = '9idbTAU:SM:ST:ActPos')[source]¶

class pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.Beamline2IDELoadOptions(base: pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.BaseLoadOptions = <factory>, *, mda_folder: str, _mda_file_pattern: str = '2xfm_(\\d+)\\.mda', _angle_pv_string: str = '2xfm:m60.VAL', channel_data_path: str = '/MAPS/XRF_roi', channel_names_path: str = '/MAPS/channel_names')[source]¶

Bases: MDAPEARLoadOptions

base: BaseLoadOptions¶
channel_data_path: str = '/MAPS/XRF_roi'¶
channel_names_path: str = '/MAPS/channel_names'¶
mda_folder: str¶

Folder containing MDA files, which in turn contain information about the measurement, including the measurment angle.

class pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.LYNXLoadOptions(base: pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.BaseLoadOptions = <factory>, *, dat_file_path: str, selected_experiment_name: Optional[str] = None, selected_sequences: Optional[tuple[int]] = None, is_tile_scan: bool = False, selected_tile: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶

Bases: PEARLoadOptions

base: BaseLoadOptions¶
dat_file_path: str¶
is_tile_scan: bool = False¶

Specifies if data was taken in tile scan configuration. You can tell if data was taken in tile scan configuration by checking if the scan numbers in the tomography_scannumbers file

selected_experiment_name: str | None = None¶

Name of the experiment to load. Use “unlabeled” to refer to experiments that do not have a name specified in the dat file.

selected_sequences: tuple[int] | None = None¶

List of sequence numbers to load in. Each sequence corresponds to a set of measurements taken sequentially over a 360 degree range. The sequence number of a projection comes from the dat file.

selected_tile: int | None = None¶

The tile number to select. This is 1-indexed, so the minimum allowed value is 1 and the maximum allowed value is equal to the number of tiles.

Folder containing MDA files, which in turn contain information about the measurement, including the measurment angle.

class pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.PEARLoadOptions(base: pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.BaseLoadOptions = <factory>)[source]¶

Bases: ABC

base: BaseLoadOptions¶
pyxalign.io.loaders.pear.options.field(*, default=<dataclasses._MISSING_TYPE object>, default_factory=<dataclasses._MISSING_TYPE object>, init=True, repr=True, hash=None, compare=True, metadata=None, kw_only=<dataclasses._MISSING_TYPE object>)[source]¶

Return an object to identify dataclass fields.

default is the default value of the field. default_factory is a 0-argument function called to initialize a field’s value. If init is true, the field will be a parameter to the class’s __init__() function. If repr is true, the field will be included in the object’s repr(). If hash is true, the field will be included in the object’s hash(). If compare is true, the field will be used in comparison functions. metadata, if specified, must be a mapping which is stored but not otherwise examined by dataclass. If kw_only is true, the field will become a keyword-only parameter to __init__().

It is an error to specify both default and default_factory.
